intro: Basselinia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth basselinia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth surface. Basselinia glabrata is typically found in sandy soils in coastal areas, thriving in well-drained environments.
